    • Method Detail

      • isNull

        public static boolean isNull(@NonNull
                             java.lang.String tag,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String variableName,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String methodName,
                             java.lang.Object obj)
        Does all these lines-consuming Null Pointer checks, which we all have to write every time we call some member's field. When the object variable has null pointer null, there will be printed debug information in the Logcat with the given variable name, the name of the class the this check was called from, and the method name where this check was called from.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        variableName - String - The variable name and variable type.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        obj - Object - The variable you want to check for null pointer.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true, if the variable does have Null Pointer. Returns false, if one of the parameters has valid Pointer, including either if the parameter tag, variableName, or methodName strings has zero length.
        Since:
        1.0

      • notNull

        public static boolean notNull(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String tag,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String variableName,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String methodName,
                              @Nullable
                              java.lang.Object obj)
        Does all these lines-consuming Null Pointer checks, which we all have to write every time we call some member's field. When the object variable has null pointer null, there will be printed debug information in the Logcat with the given variable name, the name of the class the this check was called from, and the method name where this check was called from.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        variableName - String - The variable name and variable type.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        obj - Object - The variable you want to check for null pointer.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true, if the variable does NOT have Null Pointer. Returns false, if one of the parameters has Null Pointer, including either if the parameter tag, variableName, or methodName strings has zero length.
        Since:
        1.0

      • validString

        public static boolean validString(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String tag,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String variableName,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String str)
        Does all these lines-consuming check in your source code, if the String variable has null pointer, or the variable has zero length. When the String variable has null pointer, there will be printed debug information in the Logcat with the given variable name, the name of the class the this check was called from, and the method name where this check was called from.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        variableName - String - The variable name and variable type.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        str - Object - The String variable you want to check.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true, if the variable does NOT have Null Pointer, and the String has length higher than 0 (zero). Returns false, if one of the parameters has Null Pointer, including either if the parameter tag, variableName, or methodName strings has zero length.
        Since:
        1.0

      • invalidString

        public static boolean invalidString(@NonNull
                                    java.lang.String tag,
                                    @NonNull
                                    java.lang.String variableName,
                                    @NonNull
                                    java.lang.String methodName,
                                    @Nullable
                                    java.lang.String str)
        Does all these lines-consuming check in your source code, if the String variable has null pointer, or the variable has zero length. When the String variable has null pointer, there will be printed debug information in the Logcat with the given variable name, the name of the class the this check was called from, and the method name where this check was called from.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        variableName - String - The variable name and variable type.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        str - Object - The String variable you want to check.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true, if the variable has Null Pointer, and the String has length equals to 0 (zero). Returns also true, if one of the parameters has Null Pointer, including either if the parameter tag, variableName, or methodName strings has Null Pointer.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • positiveInt

        public static boolean positiveInt(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String tag,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String intName,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  int basicVariable)
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        intName - - the name of the integer variable.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        basicVariable - int - The integer variable which will be checked if it is positive (Higher than 0).
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true, if the variable is positive (higher than 0). Returns false, if the variable basicVariable equals to 0 (zero), it is negative (less than 0), and/or one of the parameters has Null Pointer, including either if the parameter tag, variableName, or methodName strings has zero length.
        Since:
        1.0

      • instanceOf

        public static boolean instanceOf(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String tag,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.Object obj,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.Class<?> classType,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.String methodName)
        Checks is a given object is instance of a given class type. In case the object is not instance of this type, then will print a debug information out in the system log.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the caller Class.
        obj - Object - The object, which instance will be checked.
        classType - Class - he class type, which the object instance will be compared to.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true only if the object is instance of the given class type, otherwise false.
